content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Another one of David Augusto's 'more challenging than the average clash but all the more interesting' clashes. Compliments for the asci-art in the statement and smart translation of the pegs into random strings, through which you manage to turn plinko in a clash-sized challenge.

Ok, I had to think more than five minutes on how to interpret the statement. My problem was maybe not to read the statement carefully first, because now that I understand how the random string relates to the pegs, I see that it is technically all described in the statement. Somehow the combination of height, random, and then a seed into this random, gave in my head too much options for interpretation.

Is the 'seed' item fundamental to the added complexity? After the six minutes of thinking, I realized the task at hand, and started to plan my coding. I think the coding challenge is especially in using height and the random string to correctly map the pegs, and then to link that to an answer. That would require me another four minutes. The 'seed' does not really add to the coding complexity, while it did cause me some minutes of thinking what it all meant. I would personally prefer to dive heads on into the coding challenge after a quick understanding of the statement, which in my opinion would be better possible without the 'seed' parameter. As for the randomness of the game plinko (for which probably the 'seed' parameter is added), I would say that providing a random string already covers that part of the background story.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: After a little misunderstanding of what seed was, the game is nice
I do not understand how the "Pure luck" answer is 7. First is 0 so go left, second is 1 so go right, then for each next line the number is 0 so go left which ends with the box 1.

I don't know why someone downvoted this, but there was a positive comment here that was later removed, I suspect because they realized how trivial the solution is. Also, no upvotes. What I'm going to do is change the puzzle to actually require simulation (edit: done!), even tho it will make pachinko out to be a much more interesting game than it really is.

Goal
* I'm unable to see part of the diagram (I've tried both Firefox and Chrome): https://imgur.com/a/7ctXKpX

Constraints
* [[index]] is not defined anywhere in the statement. What does it refer to?

Thanks.

I didn't realize the unicode arrows I was using were more obscure than necessary. Hopefully it's fixed now. If not, which if any of these arrows are visible?
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/13973106/unicode-ascii-arrows-in-8-directions/74089712#74089712
I've added another test case before that. Does it help?
Yeah, the seed isn't all that critical, and you're the second person to get tripped up on it. I'll remove it.
oh I think I got it, I was missing the "seed". I will have a try with that
I can see the new arrows. Thanks.
